name: European Smoking Tobacco Association
goal:
The European Smoking Tobacco Association (ESTA) was founded in 1990 to represent the interests of the European manufacturers, distributors and importers of fine-cut tobacco, pipe tobacco, traditional nasal snuff tobacco and chewing tobacco and to actively engage with relevant stakeholders.

The 55 members of ESTA include small, medium- and mid sized companies as well as member associations from the European Union Member States and from Norway and Switzerland.

Smoking tobacco comprises approximately 12% of the total sales of tobacco products in the European Union: around 11% for fine-cut tobacco and less than 1% for pipe tobacco.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Customs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Food Safety, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Taxation, Trade
